programme.title: Elaha
programme.desc: Elaha, a young Kurdish-German woman, battles patriarchy and family expectations while seeking her own path. Elaha struggles with traditions, marriage and virginity, and she must choose between emancipation or delusion.

programme.title: A Childhood
programme.desc: As summer drags by, 13-year-old Jimmy, forced by circumstance to become an adult too soon, runs up against the limits of his small hometown and his turbulent life, caught between a mother on the slide and a stepfather who keeps her down.

programme.title: The Cuban
programme.desc: An unexpected friendship begins between an elderly Cuban musician with dementia who is brought out of his shell by his care worker, and a disillusioned young pre-med Afghan student named Mina. Through a shared love of music, both their lives are changed.

programme.title: Bluebird
programme.desc: In small town Maine, a school bus driver becomes distracted during her end-of-day inspection and fails to notice a sleeping boy in the back of the bus. What happens next shatters the tranquillity of her small logging town.

programme.title: Temporaries
programme.desc: Ariane gets a job as an interpreter at a food plant after moving back to the Richelieu Valley following a breakup. There, she finds herself torn between obeying the harsh demands of her boss and standing up for the exploited migrant workers she befriends.

programme.title: Binti
programme.desc: Faced with potential deportation as an immigrant, Binti, a 12-year-old vlogger plots a scheme with her new friend to bring their parents together to save her future.

programme.title: Who Framed Santa Claus?
programme.desc: Wonderfast, a highly successful online delivery company, enjoys great business all year around except during Christmas. Despite attempts to sabotage Santa Claus, their efforts produce unexpected results. Will the Christmas spirit prevail after all?

programme.title: 15 Years
programme.desc: After being wrongfully imprisoned for 15 years, piano prodigy Jenny meets Syrian refugee Omar and agrees to accompany him on a talent show. There, Jenny faces the man who framed her and her ex, and she must choose between vengeance and happiness.

programme.title: Elaha
programme.desc: Elaha, a young Kurdish-German woman, battles patriarchy and family expectations while seeking her own path. Elaha struggles with traditions, marriage and virginity, and she must choose between emancipation or delusion.

programme.title: Cloud Under The Roof
programme.desc: Paul, Julia, and Lilly are a happy family, until Julia dies unexpectedly. For the sake of his daughter, Paul wants to function and suppress his grief. Lilly keeps challenging him with her imagination and her very own view of Mum's death.

programme.title: Wars
programme.desc: Following in her father’s footsteps, and yearning to fill the existential emptiness within her, 20-year-old Emma decides to join the army. In an environment of harsh discipline and repressive rules, Emma unexpectedly falls in love with her superior.

programme.title: Sarah Kohr: The Devil's Moor
programme.desc: While driving with her mother, detective Sarah Kohr witnesses a robbery at a gas station and intervenes. After subduing the perpetrator who turns out to be just a 15-year-old, she has to investigate how he was able to get his hand on a live weapon.

programme.title: On The Way Home
programme.desc: Chi-Young is stuck in a traffic jam while running late for his son’s birthday celebration. As work issues and a near-miss traffic accident pushes the pressure to a boiling point, Chi-Young finds himself at the verge of a breakdown.

programme.title: Oskar & Lilli: Where No One Knows Us
programme.desc: Chechen siblings Oskar and Lilli face deportation from Austria but are separated in foster care after their mother’s suicide attempt. Meeting in secret, the siblings hold onto hope that they will reunite as a family someday.

programme.title: For The Birds
programme.desc: Irma is a tomboy who believes independence is the only form of freedom. Then she meets Sampie, a charming rugby player with a heart of gold and oh-so-soft hands who sweeps her right off her feet to the altar, but not before she teaches him a thing or two.

programme.title: Hoarders S12 - EP 12
programme.desc: A reality-TV show that features compulsive hoarders--people who are addicted to filling their homes with objects--and how that spills out into their lives.

programme.title: Domino Masters - EP 2
programme.desc: Teams of domino enthusiasts go head-to-head in a competition to create mind-blowing masterpieces and take home the title and cash prize.

programme.title: Game Of Talents UK - EP 1
programme.desc: In Game of Talents performers will entertain and amaze. But there's a catch - the viewers and the contestants have no idea what those talents are. Can you tell the fire eater from the footballer or the line dancer from the lion tamer?

programme.title: Crime Scene Kitchen S2 - EP 8
programme.desc: Each episode of this cooking competition begins at the scene of the crime -- a kitchen that was just used to make an amazing, mouthwatering dessert that has since disappeared. To take the $100,000 prize, the competing dessert makers will need to prove they have the technical know-how, imagination and problem-solving skills needed to decode and re-create incredible desserts and cakes from across the world.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Spice Trail Adventure - EP 2
programme.desc: Joanna Lumley takes an intrepid 15,000-mile voyage from the remote Banda Islands in Indonesia to the stunning natural landscapes of Jordan in the Middle East, revealing the story of how West met East and how the battle to control the cultivation and sale of spices dictated the course of history for centuries.

programme.title: Binti
programme.desc: Faced with potential deportation as an immigrant, Binti, a 12-year-old vlogger plots a scheme with her new friend to bring their parents together to save her future.

programme.title: 15 Years
programme.desc: After being wrongfully imprisoned for 15 years, piano prodigy Jenny meets Syrian refugee Omar and agrees to accompany him on a talent show. There, Jenny faces the man who framed her and her ex, and she must choose between vengeance and happiness.

programme.title: Cloud Under The Roof
programme.desc: Paul, Julia, and Lilly are a happy family, until Julia dies unexpectedly. For the sake of his daughter, Paul wants to function and suppress his grief. Lilly keeps challenging him with her imagination and her very own view of Mum's death.

programme.title: Difret
programme.desc: A true story. 14-year-old Hirut is on her way home when men on horses swoop in and kidnap her. She fought back but accidently killed her would-be husband. Tenacious young lawyer Meza’s decision to defend Hirut threatens not only her career but her life.

programme.title: Sarah Kohr: The Devil's Moor
programme.desc: While driving with her mother, detective Sarah Kohr witnesses a robbery at a gas station and intervenes. After subduing the perpetrator who turns out to be just a 15-year-old, she has to investigate how he was able to get his hand on a live weapon.

programme.title: Forever
programme.desc: Childhood friends, Nina and Hugo chose different paths in life. Years later, Hugo returns to his hometown unbeknownst to him, the day before Nina's wedding. Events on the wedding day throw them back together and they embark on a new adventure.

programme.title: Oskar & Lilli: Where No One Knows Us
programme.desc: Chechen siblings Oskar and Lilli face deportation from Austria but are separated in foster care after their mother’s suicide attempt. Meeting in secret, the siblings hold onto hope that they will reunite as a family someday.

programme.title: On The Way Home
programme.desc: Chi-Young is stuck in a traffic jam while running late for his son’s birthday celebration. As work issues and a near-miss traffic accident pushes the pressure to a boiling point, Chi-Young finds himself at the verge of a breakdown.

programme.title: Backwards
programme.desc: Inspired by true events. The story of a young mother of an autistic boy, whose many years of stubbornness and the fight against bureaucracy and human heartlessness led to changes in the education system.

programme.title: For The Birds
programme.desc: Irma is a tomboy who believes independence is the only form of freedom. Then she meets Sampie, a charming rugby player with a heart of gold and oh-so-soft hands who sweeps her right off her feet to the altar, but not before she teaches him a thing or two.

programme.title: Love At First Fight
programme.desc: Between his friends and the family business, Arnaud's summer looks set to be a peaceful one. Peaceful until he runs into Madeleine, as beautiful as she is brusque, a concrete block of tensed muscles and doomsday prophecies.

programme.title: Sarah Kohr: Ward
programme.desc: It is no coincidence that detective Sarah Kohr intervenes when the life-threatening attack on a Chinese businessman in Hamburg completely overwhelms his bodyguards. Sarah knows that her former colleague Lanz was behind it, but she needs to find out why.

programme.title: Confetti
programme.desc: Due to her dyslexia, Meimei is ostracized by her school and community. Encouraged by Meimei's teacher from school, Lan leaves everything behind in China for New York City in hopes of finding an education program for her daughter.

programme.title: Writings On The Wall
programme.desc: While digesting the abrupt death of his son, Ah Song seizes Arul, a 15-year-old vandal, at his doorstep, and drags the boy along on a journey to unravel the cause of his harassments.

programme.title: Murder in Biot
programme.desc: A wealthy heiress is poisoned during a dinner of the Biot Trade Association. All the guests are potential suspects. Two days later, one of the guests dies leaving a suicide note and confessing to the murder. But Deputy Prosecutor Richard is unconvinced.
